content: ow lens from plastic sushi cross this side craft is gonna start with a strange
item that they used to divide sushi and sushi trays from supermarket sushi and I
thought what a great way to you said not have to throw it away so as we go to the
table here I have a 3/4 inch washer okay I'm gonna start out with that and you
guys have seen me do this technique before I'm just gonna hot glue it in the
center to hold it for there for a second and then fill it in and you know fill
that up and I'll just pop it off the table there and then I'm going to use
the mat and I'm going to use the hot glue gun on the edge and just edge it so
it's just not a circular totally round circle got that done spray painted it
black and there's my sushi grass so I'm going to cut it cut two of those off and
kind of squish them up bunch it up so because I want it to be to look like a
plant right kind of squish it together and then I'm gonna use my hot glue gun
and kind of a little hot glue on the bottom there then I'll put the two
together squish them up again on the bottom pull the leaves out and here we
got a nice plant alright cut some of that off there put some hot glue on it
just stick it on the base make sure it's securely glued to the base pull off some
hot glue there we go nice plant no painting required but I am gonna
paint the base so I'm gonna use this my dark brown here and just paint that base
and I'm gonna use a spiced Brown and just finish it up with some highlight so
there we go we will go to the table and I'll show you what these look like nice
way to recycle so you're not throwing that plastic away alright here we have
our adventuring party you can see those plants really look nice let me give you
a closer look at one here and the base weights it down the washer
I really like that translucency that you get with the plastic grass just really
nice and easy plant and plus it's a great way to recycle and not throw this
stuff away into a landfill so there you go
